abstract.para: The SUMup database is a compilation of surface mass balance (SMB), subsurface temperature and density measurements from the Greenland and Antarctic ice sheets. This 2024 release contains 7 483 826 data points: 2 857 256 SMB measurements, 2 727 162 density measurements and 1 899 408 subsurface temperature measurements. This is respectively 1 078 716, 20 749 and 1 893 938 additional observations of SMB, density and temperature compared to the 2023 release. Since 2023, SUMup provides not only snow accumulation on ice sheets, like its predecessors, but all types of SMB measurements, including from ablation areas. The data files are provided in both CSV and NetCDF format and contain, for each measurement, the following metadata: latitude, longitude, elevation, timestamp, method, reference of the data source and, when applicable, the name of the measurement group it belongs to (core name for SMB, profile name for density, station name for temperature). Data users are encouraged to cite all the original data sources that are being used. Issues about this release as well as suggestions of datasets to be added in next releases can be done on a dedicated user forum: https://github.com/SUMup-database/SUMup-data-suggestion/issues. Example scripts to use the SUMup 2024 files are made available on our script repository: https://github.com/SUMup-database/SUMup-example-scripts.

intellectualRights.para: This work is dedicated to the public domain under the Creative Commons Universal 1.0 Public Domain Dedication. To view a copy of this dedication, visit https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/.

section.title: Ethical Research Practices
section.para: SUMup is a compilation of published measurements taken by other researchers in the cryosphere community. Ethical practices for each individual set of measurements within SUMup are unknown.

description.para: SUMup data were collected, formatted, and compiled primarily through two methods:

1) searching data archives that traditionally host cryospheric data which included Pangaea (https://www.pangaea.de/), the Arctic Data Center (https://arcticdata.io/), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)'s National Climate Data Center (https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/) and the National Snow and Ice Data Center (https://nsidc.org/) and
2) by asking members of the cryospheric community to contribute field measurements.

Various data types are compiled into the SUMup dataset including hand-written notes, technical reports, and digital files. If any of the original data/metadata were unclear or nonexistent, the original author of the data was contacted to clarify inconsistencies or questions so the SUMup metadata is complete.

Methods for each individual dataset described in metadata and ReadMe file. The density measurement methods include different sized density cutters (generally from 100 - 1000 cubic centimeters (cc)) used in snow pits, ice core sections, neutron-density methods, X-ray microfocus computer tomography, Gamma-ray attenuation, pycnometers, Optical Televiewer (OPTV) borehole logging, and Density-and-conductivity mixed permittivity (DECOMP). The SMB measurement methods include: snowpits, firn and ice cores dated with dust, hydrogen peroxide (H2O2), ratio of stable isotopes oxygen-18 (dO18), and airborne or ground radar campaigns in which isochrones were dated and tracked. The temperature measurement methods include: snowpit surveys, open borehole measurements, and thermistor strings logged by an automated weather station.
Depending on the data source, these measurements may have been post-processed or resampled.
These diverse datasets are compiled into a single database programmatically using python scripts (https://github.com/SUMup-database/SUMup-2023-compilation-scripts).

award.funderName: Programme for Monitoring of the Greenland ice sheet (PROMICE.org)
award.title: The SUMup collaborative database: Surface mass balance, subsurface temperature and density measurements from the Greenland and Antarctic ice sheets (1912 - 2023)

dataTable.entityDescription: This file contains data on measured subsurface temperature from the Greenland ice sheet. For each measurement, the following metadata is included: latitude, longitude, elevation, timestamp, method, reference of the data source and, when applicable, the name of the measurement group it belongs to (core name for SMB, profile name for density, station name for temperature). Due to different dimensionality, the DATA and METADATA variables are saved as two different groups in the NetCDF files (‘DATA’ and ‘METADATA’)

attribute.attributeDefinition: index of temperature measurement (unique for each observation)
Name key associated to measurement <measurement_id>; (core name or location)
start date of measurement <measurement_id> (can be an estimation)
Error associated with the temperature measurement <measurement_id>
Name of the name key <name_key>. Station name of measurement group for temperature.

dataTable.entityDescription: This file contains data on measured subsurface temperature from the Antarctic ice sheet. For each measurement, the following metadata is included: latitude, longitude, elevation, timestamp, method, reference of the data source and, when applicable, the name of the measurement group it belongs to (core name for SMB, profile name for density, station name for temperature). Due to different dimensionality, the DATA and METADATA variables are saved as two different groups in the NetCDF files (‘DATA’ and ‘METADATA’)

attribute.attributeDefinition: index of temperature measurement (unique for each observation)
Name key associated to measurement <measurement_id> (core name or location)
start date of measurement <measurement_id> (can be an estimation)
Error associated with the temperature measurement <measurement_id>
Name of the name key <name_key>. Station name of measurement group for temperature.

dataTable.entityDescription: This file contains the compilation of measured surface mass balance from the Greenland ice sheet. For each measurement, the following metadata is included: latitude, longitude, elevation, timestamp, method, reference of the data source and, when applicable, the name of the measurement group it belongs to (core name for SMB, profile name for density, station name for temperature). The attribute and metadata descriptions are the same as in the 2 corresponding netCDF files for SMB in Antarctica and Greenland. They can also be found in the ReadMe.

attribute.attributeDefinition: index of smb measurement (unique for each observation)
Name key associated to measurement <measurement_id> (core name or location)
start date of measurement <measurement_id> (can be an estimation)
end date of measurement <measurement_id> (can be an estimation)
Measured surface mass balance for measurement <measurement_id>
Error associated with the SMB measurement <measurement_id>

dataTable.entityDescription: This file contains the compilation of measured surface mass balance from the Antarctic ice sheet. For each measurement, the following metadata is included: latitude, longitude, elevation, timestamp, method, reference of the data source and, when applicable, the name of the measurement group it belongs to (core name for SMB, profile name for density, station name for temperature). The attribute and metadata descriptions are the same as in the 2 corresponding netCDF files for SMB in Antarctica and Greenland. They can also be found in the ReadMe.

attribute.attributeDefinition: index of smb measurement (unique for each observation)
Name key associated to measurement <measurement_id> (core name or location)
start date of measurement <measurement_id> (can be an estimation)
end date of measurement <measurement_id> (can be an estimation)
Measured surface mass balance for measurement <measurement_id>
Error associated with the SMB measurement <measurement_id>

dataTable.entityDescription: This file contains data on measured density from the Greenland ice sheet. For each measurement, the following metadata is included: latitude, longitude, elevation, timestamp, method, reference of the data source and, when applicable, the name of the measurement group it belongs to (core name for SMB, profile name for density, station name for temperature). Due to different dimensionality, the DATA and METADATA variables are saved as two different groups in the NetCDF files (‘DATA’ and ‘METADATA’)

attribute.attributeDefinition: index of density measurement (unique for each observation)
Error associated with the density measurement <measurement_id>
name of the profile <profile_key>. Profile name of measurement group for density.

dataTable.entityDescription: This file contains data on measured density from the Antarctic ice sheet. For each measurement, the following metadata is included: latitude, longitude, elevation, timestamp, method, reference of the data source and, when applicable, the name of the measurement group it belongs to (core name for SMB, profile name for density, station name for temperature). Due to different dimensionality, the DATA and METADATA variables are saved as two different groups in the NetCDF files (‘DATA’ and ‘METADATA’)

attribute.attributeDefinition: index of density measurement (unique for each observation)
Error associated with the density measurement <measurement_id>
name of the profile <profile_key>. Profile name of measurement group for density.

otherEntity.entityDescription: This file contains the compilation of measured surface mass balance from the Greenland and Antarctic ice sheet. For each measurement, the following metadata is included: latitude, longitude, elevation, timestamp, method, reference of the data source and, when applicable, the name of the measurement group it belongs to (core name for SMB, profile name for density, station name for temperature). The attribute and metadata descriptions are the same as in the 2 corresponding netCDF files for temperature in Antarctica and Greenland. They can also be found in the ReadMe. This zip folder contains the same data as the 2 temperature netCDFs, but across 5 CSV files.

This file contains the compilation of measured surface mass balance from the Greenland and Antarctic ice sheet. For each measurement, the following metadata is included: latitude, longitude, elevation, timestamp, method, reference of the data source and, when applicable, the name of the measurement group it belongs to (core name for SMB, profile name for density, station name for temperature). The attribute and metadata descriptions are the same as in the 2 corresponding netCDF files for SMB in Antarctica and Greenland. They can also be found in the ReadMe. This zip folder contains the same data as the 2 SMB netCDFs, but across 5 CSV files.
This ReadMe file contains methods for each individual dataset described in metadata.

This file contains the compilation of measured snow, firn and ice density from the Greenland and Antarctic ice sheet. For each measurement, the following metadata is included: latitude, longitude, elevation, timestamp, method, reference of the data source and, when applicable, the name of the measurement group it belongs to (core name for SMB, profile name for density, station name for temperature). The attribute and metadata descriptions are the same as in the 2 corresponding netCDF files for density in Antarctica and Greenland. They can also be found in the ReadMe. This zip folder contains the same data as the 2 density netCDFs, but across 5 CSV files.
